random.translation[0].definitions[0].def: happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
random.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
A few random shots were fired.
We looked at a random sample of 120 families.
a random selection of women who were in the shop
random.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: She's great - she's just so random!
random.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: A test was carried out on a random sample of the cattle.
He looked at a random selection of the files.
They were asked to memorize a random sequence of numbers.
He believes the police should be able to carry out random breath tests.
The family were caught up in the random violence that haunts a neighbourhood ruled by gangs.
The atomic particles seem to move in a completely random direction.
a wave of apparently random attacks
a purely random sequence of numbers
The names are in random order.
random.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a sample, check etc in which things or people are chosen without any particular reason or pattern so that they will include a typical mixture of the larger group they represent
random.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The group polled a random sample of US manufacturers.
Pennsylvania conducts random checks on trucks to see that they are properly maintained.
a rule requiring random drug testing of airline employees
random.translation[1].definitions[1].def: an error etc that happens without any pattern, so it is difficult to say when it will happen again or why it happens
random.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Random errors in the survey will not matter greatly.
random.translation[1].definitions[2].def: without any particular reason or pattern
random.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Pollsters interviewed 1000 adults picked at random in 50 states.
